headline: Strawberry Cheesecake
description: This strawberry cheesecake is smooth and creamy with swirls of strawberry sauce baked in a graham crust without a water bath for a luscious dessert.
name: Strawberry Cheesecake
recipeIngredient: 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen sweetened sliced strawberries, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Make crust: Combine graham cracker crumbs, butter, sugar, and cinnamon in a bowl; mix well. Press onto the bottom of an ungreased 9-inch springform pan. Place in the refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Make filling: Place strawberries and cornstarch into a blender. Cover and puree until smooth.

Pour strawberry sauce into a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Boil and stir until sauce is thick and shiny, about 2 minutes. Set aside 1/3 cup strawberry sauce; cool. Cover and refrigerate remaining sauce for serving.

Beat cream cheese in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy; gradually beat in condensed milk. Mix in lemon juice and vanilla extract, then beat in eggs on low speed until just combined.

Pour 1/2 of the cream cheese mixture over crust; drop 1/2 of the reserved strawberry sauce by 1/2 teaspoonfuls on cream cheese layer. Carefully spoon remaining cream cheese mixture over sauce; drop remaining strawberry sauce by 1/2 teaspoonfuls on top. Cut through the top layer only with a knife to swirl strawberry sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven until the center is almost set, 45 to 50 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen; cool for 1 hour at room temperature. Refrigerate at least 4 hours to overnight before serving.
Serve reserved strawberry sauce with cheesecake. If sauce is too thick, stir in water.

review.reviewBody: I made this last year. It was amazing! Going to make it again this year for my bfs birthday. I used fresh strawberries instead of frozen ;)
Love this recipe as is, I get asked for it multiple times a year. I can't help but wonder if some of the negative reviewers got mixed up and used evaporated milk instead of condensed.
This strawberry cheesecake was bom it was delicious I loved it.
Great recipe. I use fresh strawberries instead of frozen/
Wonderful recipe, love it!

Turned out delicious. Used chocolate Graham crackers and omitted cinnamon but those are the only changes. Family loved it. Wish I had done the water bath so it would have been prettier, but tasted fabulous.
Follow the directions to the tea in the cake cracked multiple places and never quite finished cooking in the middle or anywhere around.

I use a different crust recipe (Nilla Wafer crust,) but I follow the cheesecake recipe exactly as posted. It is awesome! My swirls on the top never end up looking as pretty as the OP's photo, but that's not the recipe's fault. I'm driving 6 hrs to visit my daughter and SIL this weekend. The only thing they want is this cheesecake.
Good for the most part. The mixture was very tangy. But 3/4 cup of sugar helped balance it out.
My first time making a cheesecake and i am so excited to try and for family to try ??
I love it, it’s so freaking good and creamy, my family really enjoyed it
It’s excellent just follow the recipe! It’s perfect!
Amazing recipe. Have had 3 people ask for one for them. Will make many times. TY
i over-did the edges, turned out great! i put a pa of water in the oven on the rack under the cheesecake while it was baking, and let it cool down slow and in the oven and it has only ONE crack

My first time making this. I followed the recipe, it tasted delicious. Although I did used fresh strawberries instead of frozen. Next time I may just use 1/2 the suggested cinnamon in the crust. Although my cheesecake portion did turned out a bit crumbly than smooth. I would definitely use this recipe again and even change up the fruit next time. Thank you for sharing.
The cheesecake itself was firm but rich and soft. My only issue was the sauce ended up very tart. I'm sure this could be fixed easily but it was just my first attempt.
Cheesecake tasted good. Family loved it. But wasn’t any better than a Walmart cheesecake. Could have stayed in the oven a little longer. Would make again for events.
I followed the recipe, and it turned out great! I will make this again.
Great recipe have made it 2 times have to make another one soon!!!
This recipe was great ! Everyone loved it!
Changed out Strawberry for Blueberry
My cheesecake was way too jiggly in the middle after 50 minutes... I had to put the cake back in the oven for another half hour.
I used sweet canned cherries instead of strawberrys and poured it on top instead of swirling. It was a simple, easy recipe and it was really good. Not to sweet.

Surprisingly good. Goes perfect with coffee or tea. Would make again. I do have to say that for one cheesecake, it's on the pricy side.
I only did 2 packs of cream cheese, the 3rd one felt excessive. I didn't cool the strawberry sauce as I was short on time, and once I put it in the oven, cooled for about an hour, and then put it in the fridge for around 2 more hours.
Delicious! The only difference for us was we cooked the strawberry topping for about 6 minutes to thicken and it still came out great.
Made as written. We thought it was great and it turned out very pretty with the strawberry swirl on top.
The best cheesecake every
I have made this cheesecake many times and it’s always a hit. My husband constantly asks for it. I don’t make any changes and this really is very easy to make.
I've made this recipe several times and it always comes out perfect. It's great with cherries, blueberries, any fruit you like.
2nd attempt. The first time I made for Valentine's day and got raving reviews. This time it's for a group of friends from all over the world in New Zealand. Hopefully it takes the cake!
I LOVE this recipe! It’s really easy to do!

Best homemade cheesecake I've ever had! The texture came out very light too which I prefer over a dense cheesecake. The only thing I would change next time if halving the amount of strawberry puree. I don't think it needs the extra side sauce because the cheesecake itself is bursting with strawberry flavor.
This is the best ever!!!!

This is my go to cheesecake recipe. Everyone who has tried it absolutely loves it. I do use frozen unsweetened strawberries and blueberries for it and it comes out perfect. The blueberries add a tangy taste to it that is delicious.
Perfect cheese cake recipe! Will definitely use again!
Fantastic and easy to do

The recipe is fairly vague when it comes to cooking, and when you should pull the cheesecake out. Plus, I would add that you should put a cookie sheet underneath the Cheesecake in the oven, to catch any melted butter from the pan. Also, unless you have a convection oven, you need to turn the cake about every 10 minutes to ensure an even bake.
When it comes to separating the cake from the spring-form pan, use a hot knife first, then go back for a second time and just run a plastic knife around the edge to be sure.
All things considered, it is a fairly good recipe.
Amazing I made this twice!!
UMMM...Well mine didnt look super apitizing , and the taste was kinda bitter
Amazing recipe! Came out perfect the first time. I followed the recipe exactly.
It was delicious! However, it was a big mess and took a while.

I made this recipe as written except I didnt have frozen strawberries and had to use real strawberries. I feel it is missing an ingredient as it is not sweet at all, the only sugar is in the crust. It did not go over well so I am going to try another similar recipe that includes sugar in the cheesecake portion.

Delicious cheesecake!! My wife went crazy for it. I made a mistake with the graham crackers and bought sweet ones — which made it way too sweet for her (not for me!). Also; only used 1 tbs of cinnamon for the crust instead of 2. Still really good! Will perfect it in time!

This recipe was very good! I had never made a cheesecake so relied on the instructions completely for cooking time etc. I did use fresh strawberries because i was unable to find frozen sweetened strawberries. I just cut them up the day before/added sugar and then went ahead and froze them because didn't want to affect the puree if they were not frozen. This is not an overly sweet dessert (that is why my family loved it) if you want more sweetness you may add more sugar to the berries. We served the strawberry sauce on the side for dipping.
While the crust alone was wonderful, the amount of cinnamon in the crust overpowered the rest of the cake which was also wonderful. Great recipe but I will go lighter on the cinnamon next time.
Excellent recipe! I split the recipe to make two smaller pies (just doubled the crust recipe because we like a good crust) and they turned out so yummy. Thank you for sharing.
It was really good! It was pretty easy to make and even though I used fresh strawberries. For the strawberries I added about a tablespoon of sugar to them and let them sit while I prepared the crust.
loved it
This is by far the best cheesecake recipe I have ever made. I did use Raspberries instead of Strawberries, but only because I couldn't find frozen strawberries at the time. REALLY GOOD!!
I like this recipe but I only had fresh strawberries, so I used about 2 lbs of berries and added 1/2 cup sugar along with the other ingredients in the sauce. It turned out very pretty!

This is dangerously delicious and easy to make! I used peanut butter and chocolate chips in the middle and swirled chocolate syrup on the top! I left half of the cake plain for my picky eaters. It was a huge success!
First time I made this recipe, and it was so awesome! All the kids loved it, will definitely be making this again!!!
Awesome
I made this for my son, he raved about it!!!!!
Perfect and easy recipe. Wouldn't change a thing.
I live this cheesecake recipe!!! Delicious, I cheated and used store bought crust and frozen strawberries. Turned out good and creamy. My crust is
Came out perfect

This was a very good recipe and easy to make. My family loved it! The only thing I changed was the topping witch I made out of strawberry jam. I have made this multiple times and it is a party favorite! Thank you for this recipe! I have also tried it with raspberry jam and it is just as good!!
It is pretty easy to make and it is delicious
Best cheesecake ever
First attempt at cheesecake, and it turned out perfect! The condensed milk gives just enough sweetness.
I made it look like a deep dish pepperoni pizza for an Italian friend.
Yes I will it’s an awesome cake!
Wonderful cheesecake. First had this recipe made for my birthday. Began making it myself. I hold all the strawberries out for a puree topping. Beautifully rich flavor and easy to make.
This was a huge hit at our dinner party
Wonderful recipe! I omitted the cinnamon in the crust, but otherwise this is perfection. Very versatile if you want to change up the fruit or leave it out all together.
Easy and delicious

This is a wonderful cheesecake recipe! Extremely easy to make and simple ingredients! Pretty much fool proof and it comes out looking like a restaurant worthy cheesecake! Just beautiful! I made it as is, but with fresh strawberries instead of frozen and it was perfect. I can’t believe anyone would reduce the cinnamon! The cheesecake itself is not that sweet, so I would not reduce anything. The cinnamon balances it out. Wonderful recipe and definitely a keeper!!!
Really good and easy! Didnt really care for the strawberry sauce. The cake was perfect though! Ended up just drizzling caramel sauce over mine.
I added a bit of sweetener to the purée. Yes I would make it again. Very easy and tasty.
Turned out great. Was a Birthday Hit!!
This is the best cheesecake ever! I’ve made it several times and today I made it for my son’s birthday tomorrow! I only use 1/2 tsp of cinnamon though! Everybody loves this cheesecake!

I made this tonight, so I haven't ate it yet. I'm basing this on the recipe. It was easy enough to make. I have been making a basic cheesecake for several months. I got bored with making just a plain cheesecake, so I wondered if I could make something different. I followed the directions without any changes. After finishing it, there really wasn't much sauce left over. So next time I'm going to try and see what happens by not draining the strawberries.
Will make often
We didn't use a spring pan, just a regular 9 inch cake pan. It worked just fine.

I didn't change anything. It was very easy and tasted great. I'll definitely make it again. I have a strawberry patch and it produces so many strawberries that I still have frozen berries in my freezer. Since they will be producing again soon, I'm trying to use up the frozen ones from last year. Everyone really loved this cheesecake. I gave the recipe to my daughter and she made it the next night, only with pineapple.

I always make this cheesecake on special occasions and I always bring this cheesecake to gatherings and everyone always goes bonkers over it! The only thing I change is that I add fresh strawberries, add half the cinnamon, and I use graham crackers and crush them myself because it’s cheaper than the boxed graham cracker crumbs. But I absolutely love this recipe, fairly easy to make and comes out perfect every time!
*I have also experimented with using chocolate graham crackers as the crust, so delicious!
Absolutely delicious! The recipe was easy to do and follow. The cheesecake was moist, not too sweet and the crust was perfect!
None was necessary.
I used up all the strawberries in the cake and made more for serving. Added more sugar also to the sauce- it was perfect!!!
thanks, karen higgins, very cool
So delicious. I made the graham cracker crust myself and it is most definitely worth the effort! Very easy to make too. This was a big hit.

Great recipe! Followed other reviews and only put in a teaspoon of cinnamon in the crust, and it was perfect. Very creamy and just the right amount of sweetness with the strawberries. I will definitely save this to my favorites

Baked this recipe for a family friend who raved about how good it was. Said it was the best cheesecake she had in years. Mind you, this was my first time making a cheesecake as well. Just followed the recipe like it said, made no adjustments and it came out lovely.

Quite good. 
The strawberry sauce didn't came out shiny as the recipe said... don`t know why. But the taste was quite good, not oversweet. I think we could add more strawberry sauce IN the cheesecake batter to have more strawberry flavor.
Great recipe for cheesecake!

I baked crust like many other suggested prior to filling. Let it cool first. And I lightly smoothed inner layer of strawberry filling all over cake. Topped gently with next layer then used the circle of purée and swirled out. Looked just like the pic. Very pretty! Had extra cream to put on top and was a hit with family.
I used dairy free ingredients to make, same amounts it already calls for. Everyone enjoyed it.

I really enjoyed this recipe, but the recipe calls for too much cream cheese, and the cinnamon was a bit strong. I had so much of the cream cheese filling after I made this.
Loved the recipe, but it's a bit much

This is my go to cheesecake recipe. Always comes out delish. I make sure my eggs and cream cheese are almost room temp and I let the batter sit for about thirty mins before I put it in. I have not used a waterbath for this recipe but I do let it cook for the suggested time then crack the door open and shut off the oven. I let it cool all the way until basically room temp, then let it cool in the fridge for about 6-8 hours. This really helps with no cracks. Awesome recipe!
no loved it
Cooked this recipe as directed and it was a big hit with everyone at my get together. There were five people there and the cheesecake was devoured in no time. I will definitely make this again.
I made this but I bought the crust. I made 2 cheesecakes. On the 2nd cake I accidentally dropped the crust so I mixed the crust and the cheesecake together. I’ll let y’all know how it turns out
I baked the crust for 10 min before adding the cheesecake (I use chocolate graham crackers no cinnamon). The cheesecake cracked terribly. Next time I will cook it in a watwr bath like I normally do.
In the process of making this . Do I have to leave it in the fridge over night ? Or can it be served after being in there for a few hours ? Thanks

I'm sorry to say I did not enjoy this recipe! The utilization of sweetened condensed milk rather than sugar in the filling is what did this recipe in for me, I think. The flavor was bizarre for a cheesecake. Additionally, the strawberry sauce was in dire need of more sugar. I actually added a teaspoon or two of sugar, and it still wasn't enough. Maybe this recipe would be great for someone who doesn't like their "sweets" to be so sweet, or for someone who is trying to limit their sugar intake, but I can't see how it would satisfy the average person's desire for cheesecake.
I made it. It cracked in a few spots but first Strawberry Cheesecake I made.
Honestly the best cheesecake I've ever had!!!
Love it. First time making cheesecake, and it was awesome! Thanks for the recipe. I found that the cinnamon was too much, maybe put a bit less?
